qas.question: How many boroughs make up Mexico City?
How are the heads of the boroughs elected?
How were the heads of the boroughs originally established?

answers.text: appointed by the head of government of the Federal District

qas.question: When did election of borough heads begin?

context: For administrative purposes, the Federal District is divided into 16 "delegaciones" or boroughs. While not fully equivalent to a municipality, the <a0_0>16<a0_0/> boroughs have gained significant autonomy, and since <a4_0>2000<a4_0/> their heads of government are elected directly by <a1_0>plurality<a1_0/> (they were previously <a2_0>appointed by the head of government of the Federal District<a2_0/>). Given that Mexico City is organized entirely as a Federal District, most of the city services are provided or organized by the <a3_0>Government of the Federal District<a3_0/> and not by the boroughs themselves, while in the constituent states these services would be provided by the municipalities. The 16 boroughs of the Federal District with their 2010 populations are:
